newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana appoints new acting foreign minister.
newsitem.headline: Ghana appoints new acting foreign minister.

text.p: Ghana's president Jerry Rawlings has switched Obed Asamoah from his role as one of Africa's longest-serving foreign ministers, an official statement said.
Local Government Minister Kwamena Ahwoi takes over as acting foreign minister, the statement released on Thursday said.

Asamoah, who took over foreign affairs in January 1982, will now concentrate full-time on the jobs of attorney general and justice minister, which he previously held in a temporary capacity alongside his foreign affairs portfolio.
Both Asamoah and Ahwoi are old hands who have been with Rawlings since his revolutionary days in the early eighties.
Political analysts said Ahwoi is regarded as an intellectual driving force in the government.
